column4: my home folder is a symlink to my older home folder (from another partition). bash seems to detect this and expands the symlink into the physical path, which i hate. why does it behave like this in ubuntu and how can i change this?
why not just mount your old home folder as /home?
how can i mount... a dir?!
it is not a whole partition, it is just a dir!
ah sorry thought you had a similar setup to mine
yes, i myself am considering using a whole partition as a home partition
use the menu editor to see what command the shortcut runs
i don't have that menu... my menu is different
i simply don't know where the menu editor is! kmenuedit is not what you mean, i assume; right?
my menu editor is not in my menu... so i have to access it from the console...
ohh, i never heard of any such command :)
i thought it was english, never thought it was (ba)sh
I think they are getting one in dapper.  You could set up a nautilus script to do it though
